Provide a technical implementation roadmap with specific file references.

SPLICE Conversion & Sales Optimization Report
Executive Summary
You have a strong technical foundation and a visually premium brand. The "Dark Mode" aesthetic aligns perfectly with professional video editors.

However, there is a critical friction point in your monetization loop: The Extension-to-Purchase Bridge. A user who installs the extension has no direct path to buy a license from within the panel. This is likely the biggest "leak" in your funnel.

This report outlines actionable steps to plug this leak and optimize every step of the user journey, from Landing Page to Checkout to Daily Usage.

1. The "Golden" Opportunity: Extension Optimization
The extension is your product, but it currently lacks sales drivers.

ğŸ”´ Critical Fixes (High Impact)
Add a "Buy License" Button in the Panel

Current State: The Login modal only asks for a License Key or Email Lookup. If I am a new user who just downloaded the trial, I have to guess where to go to buy.
Recommendation: Add a prominent "Get License" or "Upgrade to Pro" button in the Login Modal and potentially in the main header (replacing the generic "Login" badge for non-active users).
Action: Link directly to https://splice-video.com/pricing (or your production URL).
Smart Empty State

Current State: "Click GO to detect silences and takes".
Recommendation: Use this empty space to sell the dream.
Copy Suggestion: "Ready to save 2 hours? Open a sequence and click GO to let AI handle the rough cut."
Trial Visibility

Current State: It is unclear if the user is on a trial or what their remaining credits are until they hit a limit.
Recommendation: Show a "Trial: 12 days left" or "2 hours processing remaining" countdown in the footer or header. Scarcity drives action.
2. Website & Landing Page Optimization
Your landing page is visually strong but can be sharpened for higher conversion rates.

ğŸ¦¸ Hero Section (
Hero.tsx
)
Real Video is Mandatory: The current placeholder div with "Watch 2-minute demo" is a conversion killer.
Fix: Embed a high-quality, autoplaying (muted) loop of the actual extension in actionâ€”specifically the "silences disappearing" moment. Seeing is believing.
Headline Tweak: "The AI Co-pilot for Premiere Pro" is good, but "Edit 10x Faster" is a bit clichÃ©.
Try: "Cut Your Editing Time in Half. Automatically." (Specific benefit > Vague promise).
Sticky CTA: Ensure the "Start Free Trial" button follows the user as they scroll (e.g., in the sticky header, which you already haveâ€”good job).
ğŸ’° Pricing Strategy (
Pricing.tsx
)
The "Fake Urgency" Risk:
Issue: The "Beta Pricing Ends Soon" banner and countdown timer reset effectively every month/session. Smart users (developers/editors) notice this and lose trust.
Recommendation: Replace fake countdowns with real scarcity based on product milestones. E.g., "Early Adopter Pricing ends when v2.0 launches." or simply remove the countdown and keep the "Beta Discount" badge. Trust converts better than fake panic.
The "Starter" vs "Pro" Gap:
Issue: $15 -> $39 is a big jump (>100% increase).
Recommendation: Ensure the "Pro" value checks out. "Social reframe" and "Text-based editing" are strong differentiators. Highlight them more aggressively in the comparison chart.
ğŸ§  Trust & Social Proof
"10,000+ Professional Editors": If this number is real, keep it. If it's inflated, remove it.
Why: If a user spots a lie (e.g., low view count on the demo video vs 10k users), they will doubt the software works.
Alternative: "Trusted by editors at [Logo] [Logo] [Logo]" is more powerful than a raw number.
3. Checkout & Onboarding Friction
ğŸš¦ The Checkout Flow
Simplify: Only ask for Email + Credit Card. Do not ask for Name or Address unless legally required for tax. Every extra field drops conversion by ~10%.
One-Click Trial: If you offer a 14-day trial, consider a flow that doesn't require a credit card upfront for the "Starter" tier, or requires it but clearly states "You will not be charged today."
ğŸ“§ The Welcome Email
Immediate Value: The moment they sign up, send an email with:
The Download Link (Main CTA).
Their License Key (displayed clearly).
A 30-second "Getting Started" GIF.
4. Technical Performance & SEO
layout.tsx
 Metadata: Your metadata is decent, but ensure keywords include "Premiere Pro Plugin", "Auto-cut silence", and "Podcast editor".
Load Speed: The site uses framer-motion heavily. Ensure it's not blocking the First Contentful Paint (FCP).
Mobile View: While editors work on desktop, they buy on mobile (scrolling in bed/commute). Ensure the Pricing page looks perfect on iPhone/Android.
ğŸ— Implementation Plan (Recommended Next Steps)
Phase 1 (Quick Wins - < 1 Hour)

 Add "Buy License" link to Extension Login Modal.
 Update Hero Headline for specificity.
 Verify "Contact Sales" button on Pricing page works.
Phase 2 (Design & Content - 1-2 Days)

 Record and embed the real Demo Video.
 Refine Pricing Page copy to reduce "fake urgency".
 Add "Trial Status" indicator to Extension Header.
Phase 3 (Deep Optimization)

 Implement A/B testing on the Hero CTA (Start Trial vs Watch Demo).
 detailed "How to" / Docs section to help retention.
